inn1.comm: Bukhari has begun well, gets Smith to fell for a gentle away-going delivery outside off and it bursts through the slips all the way to the boundary
no feeling for this one, he just gets the front foot out and drives it to the right of mid off for another boundary
better delivery, making him defend after it pitched on a length around off stump
oh well, not the start Netherlands would have wanted, Smith leans out to despatch another one wide of mid off, who goes through the motions of trying to chase it
cut away off the back foot, but point dives to his left to save some runs
the man at short extra cover is in business right away, as Smith drives one down to him off the front foot
tentatively goes searching for this length delivery outside off stump, pushes inside the line, and is beaten
comes forward lazily and dead bats this one down the pitch
goes forward again outside off stump, and guides this one down to third man, Gayle is away
some bounce there for the bowler, but the line is all wrong, way down the leg side
he is putting in a lot of effort, but the ball is climbing feebly onto Smith, who defends it as if it were the easiest thing in the world
takes a half-step out and reaches to drive this angled ball, but short extra cover is a good man to have for such strokes
stays in the crease this time and plays out another length ball in to the off side
Gayle is surprisingly tentative while Smith is surprisingly aggressive, pokes at another one angled away outside off
lets the ball come on to bat from a length and pushes out towards point, this is a cautious start from Gayle so far
a half-sign of aggression from the big fella, gets forward and rides the bounce on this one to punch to point
he lets this one in the channel outside off stump go, hmm
very watchful from Gayle indeed, gets one on the pads, but plays it away to midwicket

a maiden to Gayle, from Bukhari, would you believe it, Gayle stays rooted to the crease and brings down the bat at an angle, some extra bounce, and the ball bounces close to the stumps, and rolls away
some swing, almost in the blockhole, good delivery, Smith is surprised and digs it away in to the on side
on the lookout for some swing, this time there isn;t much, he gets to the pitch and slams it to mid off
super save in the covers, some steps to his right and went sprawling for the ball, it was crashed off the back foot, and he saved four runs for his side
a push, a firm push, but a push nevertheless, gets one pitched up and shows the full face of the bat, and the outfield takes care of the rest, Smith picks up a boundary straight past the bowler
the second time he has edged, but there is hardly any carry in this surface, goes between keeper and slip on the bounce, and beats them both, lucky runs for Smith
quicker one swinging on the pads, flicked away to square leg
he stands tall in the crease, the pace is so gentle it takes ages to arrive, when it does, he tonks it to mid off
flicked away through square leg, he hasn;t gone hard at the ball yet
lots of searching and feeling being done outside off stump, SMith gets nothing for this waft, not even an edge
defended solidly off the back foot in to the off side
pushes inside the line, and opens the face to run down one on middle to third man
Gayle drives through the line of this length ball, and trots a single as mid off runs across to field
wide outside off stump, just angled across the left-hander who watches it go
still wider outside off, Gayle continues with just watching it go, but the umpire thinks it is too wide, so it is
plonked down on the off side from the crease
hey, this is the real Gayle, gave him a half-charge but he continues to spray it wide outside off, and Gayle watches it go again, this time from down the track
forced away to the right of point, Netherlands are doing a lot of diving around, point joins in the fun
again Smith prods at one leaving him outside off stump, and misses, this time it carries to the keeper, who is standing up a long way now
gets some width, it is shorter too and cuts it wide of third man, Gayle was ambling the first and had to really hurry back for the second
looks to force it through the off side, but is beaten, by the angle, by the bounce, by lack of footwork
no room for Gayle outside off stump, pushes out to mid off
still not much width, Gayle is itching for some action now, tries to play the forcing drive, but mistimes it in to the off side
gets away with one on the pads, Gayle just nudges it in front of square leg for a run
puts in tonnes of effort, gets some bounce on leg stump, he brings it down towards square leg
delicately dabs one very close to off stump to the right of third man, a misfield and some positive intent makes him come back for the second
again he steers one outside off stump down to third man, just stays beside the line, and guides it in the end

well, all the desperate diving from point can't save this one, Smith had driven this wide delivery close to point, but he dived and let it go through his hands, and that's all it takes on this fast outfield
guided away to point, this time not much on the shot, and point gets behind it nicely
eased away in to the off side, Smith is looking a lot less tentative now
confidently worked away to midwicket off the back foot, some pace on this one
Smith gets some width outside off stump, it's enough for him, bends the knee and sends it racing through cover
width, shortish delivery, Smith does not need more invitation, happily hammers it between cover and point for another boundary, Netherlands looking flat noe
Gayle stays in the crease yet again, and drives through the line, not much pace in this pitch to his liking, mid off fields
again the lack of pace has him taking one on the pads, some interest from Netherlands, but that pitched way outside leg
cannot get the boundary that is his oxygen, forces this length ball away down to mid off
this is a tight line for Gayle, very close to off stump, he tries to force it away again through the off side, but the infield is packed
Bukhari goes down the leg side this time, beats the keeper as well, even if Gayle is not getting the runs, they find other ways to increase their tally
good skiddy delivery, does not bounce much but hurries away outside off stump, he is beaten on the cut
neat end to a tight over, effort delivery thuds in to Smith;s straight bat, and rolls away to mid off
as calm a Gayle as you'll ever see, guides this one outside off wide of third man
looses this one, ends up as a high full toss, Smith is surprised and pushes it away to mid off
Chris Gayle has a boundary, finally, it is the tenth over, takes a step out, gets to the half volley, and crashes it past mid off
have the floodgates opened? Gayle gets a fuller one, and this time he forcefully pushes it to the left of mid off
more fuller stuff from Tendo, this is a horror start for him, Gayle merrily tonks it over short extra cover, and past mid off, three in three, this is no imposter, this is CH Gayle, alright
now he even keeps the strike with a single down to mid off
gentle wide delivery down the leg side, got away with it
whoops, this one was just a nudge, he just helped it backward of square leg, and it goes all the way to the boundary, now come on, how well was this timed?
lets this one outside off stumps go
picks up a single through midwicket, think 'long haul'
they are not helping by bowling on the pads, another single down to fine leg
this is poor bowling, yet another one on the pads, Gayle tickles it as fine and as softly as a Gayle can, and it runs away way past the man at short fine leg
worked away straight to short fine leg, Loots gets away this time
slapped away off the front foot to sweeper cover
wide outside off stump, and the keeper fails to collect it cleanly
much better from Tendo, this is how he bowled against England, nips in on the stumps, making him defend hastily

this is notdropped gosh, that should have been taken, Sarwan was a bit lazy with his feet, and just drove away from the body, it flew to sweeper cover who seemed to have it in control, but clanged it as he went down on his knees
driven hard but straight to extra cover
Gayle continues to pick up the singles as easily as ever
on the stumps. Sarwan blocks it off the back foot
loses his line, and concedes four, Sarwan does not miss out, shuffles and sends one down the pads past fine leg for a boundary
full on the pads, Gayle flicks it backward of square leg
the batting Powerplay did you say, Gayle goes as soon as it starts, swings hard at a length ball, and swings it straight down to long off, bah, whoever named this a batting Powerplay?
gets one on the pads, and is away with a flick to fine leg
slower one floated up outside off, keeps low, he is beaten on the cut
nice delivery from Tendo, fuller and quicker, close to the off stump, he squeezes it out to short extra cover
goes wide down the leg side, have been a few of those, and it is not taken cleanly, there have been numerous of those
tight single, well run, it was driven hard, and got quickly to extra cover, but Pollard has big feet, and bigger strides
flatter and on the stumps, Sarwan is forward in tight defence
still flatter, this time he gets to it and drives to long off, brings Pollard on strike, also, 200 is up
whoosh, he didn't seemed to hit it hard at all, just took a step out and swung at the right instant, would you believe it, it disappeared somewhere into the top tier
goes harder at this one, but along the ground to long off
now Sarwan goes even harder, to one outside off stump, but cannot get it past extra cover
Pollard will keep the strike with a single
poor ball, Pollard takes toll, gets one full on the pads, and flicks it past a helpless short fine leg
Pollard displays his strength, again just seemed a push, but he also has the gift of timing along with power, lofted a length ball over extra cover, just like that
now Sarwan comes on strike as Pollard hits a fuller one through midwicket
flicks a full toss, another full toss, poor bowling really, a misfield at square leg too, troubles for Netherlands, Pollard collects four more
massive, huge, gets underneath a full one on the stumps, sends it into the stratosphere. too bad it had to come down, came down in the top tier, Pollard has come in and just exploded
the absolutely right thing to do, tap to covers and bring the brute on strike
good delivery, back of a length outside off, he stays on the back foot and fends it away to short third man
he misses out, cuts a delivery from outside off stump to point
Tendo appeals, picks up the ball, then appeals again, no response from umpire Saheba, he had rapped Sarwan on the pads but it looked like sliding down leg
elegance amid the violence from Sarwan, it was a full toss, and he caresses it through extra cover off the front foot
Sarwan continues to succeed with this brand of non-violence, gets one on the pads, and flicks it wristily in front of square leg for successive boundaries
darts in with the angle from short of a length, Pollard goes outside the line, drops it in front of square leg, and off they go
Sarwan likes width outside off stump, he loves it, gives himself even more room outside leg, and picks it high over cover, one bounce and over the ropes, problems for Netherlands from both ends
he gives him room down leg side this time, Sarwan cannot capitalise though

even this goes for four, Sarwan was backing away outside leg, the bowler followed him with a slower one, and Sarwan asjusted to swat it past midwicket, it teased the fielder all the way and trickled over the ropes
brings Pollard on strike now with a single to cover
Pollard cannot get underneath this slow fullish delivery, and in the end drives it past the bowler along the ground
Sarwan keeps strike with yet another single, 56 off the Powerplay, alright this was a batting one
straight on middle stump, kept a shade low, Sarwan jabbed it away in the end

dropped Sarwan survives again, he came down the track, stood still and gave it everything, it looped away behind the keeper, three men converged on it, and one of them managed to drop it, wow, what a clanger
mowed away off the back foot, it was very short, very slow, and down the pads, goes backward of square
nifty from Sarwan, some width outside off stump, and Sarwan just helps it on tis way, ans short third man has no chance at all
they even pinch an extra single now, it was pushed to midwicket, but the bowler lumbered to it, they had scrambled across for two
Sarwan continues to make them pay for those dropped lollies, keeps strike with a single through square leg

they don't come closer than those, full on the stumps, misses the waft across the line, umpire Taufel gives him out straight away, he was hit on the toes, and was on the crease too, Sarwan finally runs out of luck, but it has been a fluent knock
this will do, shuffles across to one on the pads,and sends it racing past short fine leg
stands tall and looks to punch on the up through cover, everything right, except he did not connect
bowls it very full outside off stump, he looked to squeeze it past backward point, but cannot connect again
huge backlift, sends this full delivery on the stumps past Pollard to long on
deft from Pollard, no power in that one, just shuffled across the stumps, took a length ball from middle stump, and turned the wrists to send it to the right of short fine leg, superb placement
another of those ones that keep teasingly low, he gets a huge inside edge as he looks to force it off the back foot
murder, scythed through the line, it was tossed up a bit outside off stump and he swung it over wide long off, that was only going one way, over the ropes
too quick outside off for Pollard, too quick for the keeper as well, rolls away off his gloves to short third man
Sammy tries to go over long off too, like Pollard, but does not connect that well, and picks out the man on the boundary neatly, maybe he could have just left it to Pollard, well he is gone now
shuffles across a lot, and gets an inside edge through square leg, well, Pollard is back on strike
good delivery, fired in fast, almost caught Pollard in front, he just about managed to push it away past the non-striker
Chanders nudges niftily down to fine leg, helps that the ball was on his pads
short of a length outside off stump, he waited on it and looked to carve it over extra cover, but was beaten
angles this one in on the stumps, he shuffles and spirits it away wide of deep midwicket
and again, gets a full one on the pads this time, and flicks it wide of deep midwicket
looks to heave this length ball out of the ground, it goes on a couple of bounces to long on
Chanders with a easy-on-the-eye cover drive that earns him a single to sweeper cover
pushed away through point off the front foot, Pollard is back on strike
Pollard almost takes out Chanders with a brute of a drive, uses those powerful arms to slam it down the ground, long on did well to cut off the boundary
Chanders sweeps, does not connect, but collects some leg byes as it rolls away past the keeper fine on the off side

Seelar has another, it is Chanders this time, looks to reverse sweep this one angling in on leg stump, that;'s what it does in the end, goes past his bat to crash in to leg stump, Seelaar roars, he is delighted
full toss and he drives it in the air back to the bowler who leaps to his right, but cannot hold on to the tough chance
absolutely smashed over wide long off, Pollard goes past fifty, what a typhoon
wide down the leg side, how many of those have we seen today?
pushed towards mid off, and takes the quick run, nicely done to bring the big man on strike
looks to kill this one over long on, but gets an inside edge that almost takes out the square leg umpire
does the correct thing, takes a single to give Pollard the strike
they just keep coming, no respite, too much width and he slams it past sweeper cover in a flash
worked away off the back foot from just short of a length through midwicket
whips this full delivery down to long on for another run
good delivery, angled in on a length and goes between bat and pad as he lunges forward
Thomas he is, not Edison, but he is inventive alright, goes way outside off stump, and scoops a fuller one high over short fine leg, looks so cute when it comes off, when it does
back of a length one on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
jabbed away off the back foot to short third man for a single

Pollard goes, finally, after lots of carnage, he looked to caused some more this time, but got too much below a length ball, and skied it high in the air, long on had settled under it, and took it cleanly in the end, 60 off 27, phew
punched down to long on off the back foot
skips down the track and eases this one away through midwicket
clean shot, Miller away off the first delivery, like Shahzad yesterday, gets one in the slot and gives it the full face of the bat, and it flies down the ground, one bounce in to the boundary
hustles a single backward of square leg by shuffling across the stumps
hurries down the pitch, makes room and carves this one wide of extra cover
slower one, cannot get it away off the pads, rolls away to the keeper
Tendo tempts fate again, and this time Miller get bat on it, stands dead still, and at the last moment tickles it fine off his pads, and it comfortably beats short fine leg
looks to whack a short one over long on, but gets a top edge that goes to the man there on a couple of bounces
has a go at one outside off stump, and goes nowhere
picks a single as he works this one away to deep midwicket off the hips

Bukhari gets one, Thomas looked to work it away from the stumps, missed and was hit on the pads, the bowler got the decision in his favour, Thomas goes for the review right away, he was hit on the knee roll but was bending down too, replays show it is taking out leg stump, umpire Saheba raises the finger again, and Thomas departs
and gives a back of a length ball a big thump, the fielder came hurrying in from long on, trying to go for the catch but it dropped short of him
smashed away to sweeper cover for a single, West Indies end on 330

inn2.comm: tossed up on off, he leans forward and blocks to the off side
with outside off, he goes for the cut this time and finds point. Alright, I am muting the TV. Devon Thomas has started his irritating chatter
better line, close to off stump, Kerveezee gets behind the line
again, back of a length and on the stumps, defended carefully down the track and he gets a single this time.
inside edge saves him from a potential lbw. Plays back to an armer and is nearly struck in front. The bat came down just in time.
defends the last ball safely down the track. Tight start from Benn here.
Roach lands this on the pads and it is eased along towards fine leg for another single
quick and back of a length on off stump, not much to be done with that. It is defended down the track
looks to get forward this time, but the length is not there for the drive. Inside edges the shot to the leg side

Gayle has struck. The wicket goes to Roach, but that was all Gayle. Length ball on off stump from Roach, Barresi goes for a nervous half-prod, half-poke non-drive without moving the feet and it gets the outside edge. Sammy's eyes at second slip light up as he jumps across to his left. Gayle at first slip calmly tumbled across to his right. Sammy missed the ball. Gayle was ready. Not deterred by the distraction, he pouched it low. And then he smiles. And smiles.
banged in back of a length, Cooper is confidently on the front foot as defends down the track
again, Cooper pushes his front foot across and defends from back of a length down the track
length ball on off stump, pushed into the covers without much intent
little more air from Benn, Kervezee leans out to the pitch and drives smoothly through the covers for a couple
back of a length and straighter this time, defended off the front foot to the leg side
Benn slips in the armer, hurries on towards leg stump and Kervezee does well to defend off the back foot
Kervezee hops out of the crease and makes room as he moves to the leg side, but is still too close to power the drive away through the off side
ends the over with another check drive as he reaches out and plays into the covers

whoa, Roach is getting some nip here. This one jags in from back of a length and rises off the track menacingly and Cooper has to hurriedly pull the front foot back after thinking of the cover drive. Inside edged onto the pad
this one keeps a touch low on off stump as Cooper looks to defend, and he gets it away to the leg side.
again, lowish bounce on off stump as Cooper plays around it and gets it to midwicket
legcutter, shapes away from outside off, and Cooper steers it through point for a single
another one outside the line of off stump, straightens off the deck and Kervezee pokes it to the off side
fuller length and a hint of away shape, nearly squares up a slightly lazy Kervezee who looks to flick airily. Thick outside edge goes away to the left of the bowler
shot from Cooper, gets a flighted ball on middle and doesn't over-hit it. He waits for it to come on and then laces it past extra cover with a flourish for four
good delivery, shortens the length, negates the drive and forces him to defend to the off side
similar delivery, tight line on off stump and Cooper again covers the line to defend
tossed up on middle and leg, Cooper taps it away to mid on and gets a single

Kervezee goes downtown (to Chandni Chowk). Jumps out of the crease, reaches the pitch as Benn gives it air, and launches him with the spin wide of long off for four. Almost a six that, he hit it really well
Benn shortens the length again, and Kervezee stays on the crease to play it to the off side
back of a length and angling in from outside off, defended solidly off the back foot
strays on the pads, worked with the wrists through mid on for a single
short of a length and a foot outside off, Cooper gets half across and defends to the off side

that's a special shot from Cooper. Bouncer at 142 kph, it takes some hitting. More importantly, it takes some getting into a safe place. Cooper trots inside the line and pulls with disdain in the air through backward square leg. I daresay, that's the shot of the day. And we've seen some today.
he again shuffles into line with middle and leg as Roach lands one on the stumps, and pushes it to mid-on for another single
Kervezee hangs in the crease, covers the line of a length ball and blocks down the line
tossed up on off stump, almost too full for the drive, it is pushed to cover
lazy fielding at cover, Cooper gets a single with a check drive as the fielder refuses to bend and collect.
top timing from Kervezee, leans across to middle and off, gets the flighted ball on the pads and flicks it with subcontinental expertise through midwicket

and gone. Benn's lulled him out of the crease with the possibility of a flighted offering, with the added temptation of mid-on inside the circle. Once he saw him coming, he held it back on off stump and got it to rip across. Kervezee was too far into the shot to pull out, and went for the swing anyway. No luck, as it breaks past the outside edge, and the keeper does the rest.,
tossed up on off, he leans out to pat it into the off side
on middle and leg to end the over, Tendo gets his feet across and flicks to midwicket
lively from Roach, legcutter at 139.7 kph, squares up Tendo who is hanging back in the crease, and it runs off a thick outside edge through backward point
fuller length on off stump, Cooper presses forward and defends into the off side
this one angles down the leg side at 143.9 kph and he glances it backward of square to get off the mark
Tendo is away, Roach is looking for the quick delivery searching for the pads, and Tendo's twinkling feet get him inside the line and he happily nudges it along to fine leg for four more
Tendo again gets one on the pads and tucks it square for another single

Benn might have got rid of Tendo here. Umpire Saheba says out. It is being reviewed. Tossed up on leg stump and fired in at some pace too. Tendo was just done for pace as he shaped into a forward defensive. The ball straightened off the deck and was headed for the leg stump. His bat was outside the line though, and it thudded low into the shin. Gone.
tossed up on leg stump, he leans out to get to the pitch and works it square
fired in fast on the stumps, he plays back and gets it away to the leg side
tossed up on off, defended from the crease with a half push forward
leans across to a delivery flighted on leg stump and works it cautiously to the leg side
fast and furious from Roach, hurries onto the pads and the batsman is beaten for pace

Bas Zuiderant. Blast Zuiderant. Roach has blasted his stumps out with a fast and straight missile that had off stump written all over it. Bas tried to get forward and cover the line, but his reluctant forward prod was not going to get him anywhere. He played across the line, the ball slipped between bat and pad, and flattened off stump. Roach is delighted.
and he tries to york him first ball, just about manages to get the bat down and keep it out
this one thunders in towards leg strump and he is late on the flick again. Misses to make contact.
again, full and on leg stump, Roach has them hopping around with raw pace here. de Grooth gets it out to the leg side somehow
tossed up on off, de Grooth defends sedately

you got to give it to Benn. Slips in the armer, seemed worth a shout as the batsman prodded with bat and pad half forward. The keeper goes up immediately. Sammy goes up immediately. Benn doesn't care. Even as they appeal, he is walking back to bowl the next ball. Even as they contemplate the review, he is at the top of his run up for the next ball! Sammy stops him and reviews it. This looks pretty close. Landed on off and middle, and straightens, Thudding into the middle of middle stump, some two-thirds of the way up. Sammy and the keeper have got Benn a wicket, which he did not seem to want.
flighted outside off, Borren reaches across to cover the line and defend to the off side
this time he slips onto the pads and Borren scratches it out to the leg side for a single
breaks away from outside off, he reaches out to smother the spin and defends with the spin to the off side
on the front foot again for the last ball, defended down the track to end the over
oho, don't think Borren has seen so much pace so often. Banged in short, looking for the head, Borren hangs back, gets the bat up to save the face and somehow gets it to the leg side for one
Cooper seems quite stable in the shambles, gets half forward and covers the line a Roach hits the line of middle stump
on middle and leg this time, Cooper gets the front foot across to cover the line and defends to the leg side
drives with more assurance now, another one on leg stump, driven solidly but straight to mid on
offcutter outside off from Roach, and a huge drop in pace. Cooper spots the variation, pushes down the line and defends solidly
the attempted yorker ends up on leg stump as a full toss and is punched with fluency, but again Cooper finds mid on
full toss on off stump, driven without much timing into the covers
on leg stump this time, Borren gets the front foot out and smothers the spin
The Dutch are just looking for stability here, Borren reaches across and defends down the track from outside off
this one is on the pads, Borren works it square for a single
short of a length and just outside off, he looks to cut but finds point
fired in full on leg stump, Cooper digs it out and the bowler fields
slides the first one down the leg side, and Borren gets some bat on it as it speeds away to fine leg
on leg stump and straightening. Thomas, as always, appeals the ,moment it hits the pads. No one else is interested.
tossed up on off, Borren reaches across and smothers the spin
flight again, this time on leg stump and Borren pokes it to midwicket
he gets the single this time, not without some strife though as there is a direct hit at the bowler's end. Borren was guilty to ball-watching and ambling in after nurdling square
Cooper presses forward and smothers the spin with a solid defensive prod
on the pads from Benn, forced wide of mid on for a single
flatter on off stump, Cooper forces it back from the back foot towards mid off
tossed up on off stump, drived without much timing into the covers
Benn shortens the length, Borren reaches out and smothers the spin
guided with an opened face as Benn flights well outside off. Single behind point
a rare boundary brings up the Oranje 50. Short ball speared outside off, Cooper stays back and chops it behind square. Played with control. The game ambles along.
Miller spears another one too far down the leg side, and Borren glances to short fine leg
tossed up straighter this time, defended off the front foot down the track
tossed up outside leg stump, looks to sweep and gets it straight to short fine leg
again looks to sweep, can't get it away for now, Borren
persistence pays, Borren finally gets a sweep shot past short fine leg and picks up a single for his efforts
starts off with a full and friendly offering on leg stump that Borren can't get away. It runs off the pads for a leg bye to the leg side
another one on the pads, Cooper jumps inside the line and flicks it backward of square for one
moves across to off stump line, Borren gets half-forward and defends from the crease
again Borren is stodgy in his forward defensive, reaching forward and defending into the off side
back of a length on the leg stump, worked off the pads straight to mid on
ends with one on off stump, Borren continues to offer stout defence when all else fails.
turn from outside off, sharp and gets the outside edge as he leans out and looks to defend
more forthright in forward defensive this time, defended off the front foot to the off side
leans out again to the flight and smothers the spin
looks to drive with more intent this time, but finds cover
short of a length outside off, Cooper chops away square and picks a single
short of a length outside off, Cooper stays beside the line and controls the cut to pick up a single through backward point

captain removes captain. Short ball outside off, he goes for the cut and finds point to perfection. It doesn't help that Borren couldn't time it either. West Indies should look to wrap this up quickly now.
back of a length and nipping a touch away from the batsman, who leaves outside off
extra bounce outside off, hustles the batsman with extra pace as he looks to force off the back foot
fuller length, Bukhari gets forward with a little more conviction and defends
length ball again, Bukhari gets an inside edge onto the boot away to the off side
Cooper keeps going in a hopelessly lost cause, pats a single in front of square
tossed up on off and breaking away, Bukhari plays inside the line and gets a thickish outside edge
Cooper covers the deviation off the track and works with the spin into the covers
worked off the pads this time, against the spin through midwicket for one
single to covers to end the over
ah, some urgency between the wickets and Bukjari pushes into the covers and charges across. Beats the throw too, which missed the stumps anyways
back of a length on middle and leg, Cooper pats it down the ground for a single
Bukhari plays back and tries to force a short ball down the ground. It is fielded at mid on
back of a length outside off, he stays back in the crease and steers towards point
back of a length again on off stump, steered straight to point
ends the over the way it began, with a tight single. An accurate throw from mid on breaks the stumps at the bowler's end, but Bukhari hustles in on time
tossed up on middle and off, he leans out and defends down the track
ho ho hoicked! Flighted generously on leg stump and he goes for a robust slog sweep, and carts it almost all the way
holds the length back a touch and it is defended down the track
shorter still and flatter outside off, it is cut away without much timing to point
beaten by the turn off the last ball as he looks to drive airily. Good thing he did not take the foot outside, Thomas was ready for the stumping
shorter ball outside off, again Bukhari is beaten for pace as he looks to force it off the backfoot
straighter this time, high 120s, but Bukhari is struggling to get it away all the same.
and now he makes good contact with the swing, short from Sammy angled into the body and sitting up for the slap. Bukhari obliges and gets four through midwicket
grubber outside off, Bukhari stays in the crease and looks to cut. But he's missed it
fuller and on middle stump, Bukhari nearly plays all over it aqs he tries to play it to the leg side, and misses
lovely delivery from Miller, gets it to grip, spit and straighted past the outside edge as he prods forward. Tantalisingly close to the off stump
leans out and gets to the pitch and drives to the leg side
flatter on leg stump, looks to work it across the line and can't get it away
another dot ball, Bukhari is stuck on the crease as he tries to force it off the backfoot
finally gets the single through the leg side.
inducker, nips in off the seam and nearly cleans him up as he looks to swipe across the line
this one homes in onto the pads and Bukhari hops away as he tries to get bat onto it.
this time he gets the single, another swipe to the leg side and he gets bat on it
Cooper jumps into line and clips backward of square for a single
Sammy gets an outside edge with a full ball outside off, and it seems headed for the third man boundary until Benn comes down with his big foot and stops it. What a man.
angled into the pads, he goes for another big heave and doesn't make contact
tossed up on off and defended down the track
all class from Cooper. This guy can bat. Again gets the front foot down, to the pitcxh and then laces it through the covers all along the carpet.
forces him away with the turn for a single
Bukhari hangs back on leg stump and drives down to mid on
speared down the leg side, he goes for the big sweep but finds deep backward square leg
short and wide to end the over, cut away backward of point
Sammy lands this back of a length and gets it to angle in, played from the crease to the leg side
short ball outside off, stays low and scoots past the cut
Cooper fashions a cramped upper cut of sorts, and managed to place it past Pollard diving away to his left at point. Good placement, good improvisation.
closer to the stumps this time, Cooper gets in line and defends down the track
again back of a length and just outside off, he looks to open the face and steer it square
Bukhari gets a single to retain strike, goes for an ambitious backfoot carve to a full delivery on the stumps, and gets it out to deep cover
135 kph, not upto his full pace and Bukhari is early into the drive. Nearly holes out to mid off
over-pitched outside off, Cooper leans across and goes for it. He gets a single away to backward point
again over-pitched outside off, he opens the face and steers it through point for a single
offcutter, comes in sharply at 139 kph, and Cooper adjusts after getting his front foot across and defends to the off side
fuller length and searching for the lbw, defended solidly down the ground
over-pitched on middle and off, driven without much timing down the ground and they get a single between mid off and mid on
Sammy gets one to nip away from back of a length, leaden-footed poke from Cooper, he doesn't make contact
four more to Cooper, and again comes through an exquisite shot. Over-pitched outside off, he leans out and creams it through the covers. Everything about that shot looked so right.

Cooper survives a run-out chance, scrums it out to the covers and charges halfway before deciding to turn back. The throw came in and missed, he was well short. The keeper was not in position to collect.,
Cooper keeps going, another boundary as he skips with the front foot inside the line and flicks majestically through midwicket
three for the over, Sammy has fluffed his lines completely, and he lands this one well outside leg stump. Easy runs for Cooper, skips inside the line and dinks it along behind square for four.
Roach fires it in full and straight on leg stump and Bukhari digs it out to midwicket for a single
Cooper has a fifty here, the lone oranje spot for the Dutch. Back of a length outside off, he tries to get besude the line and cut, and gets an under edge that scoots away to third man
this time he middles the steer, and gets a single from outside off to deep backward point

Roach has hit the stumps again. It's a sound strategy - fast and straight for the lower order batsman. Bukhari has played back too many times today, and he's cleaned up as one delivery stays a little low. He's played all over it and the stumps are splattered.
143 kph, fired down the leg side at great pace and touches Seelaar on the way.

huge appeal for lbw and it is turned down. Not reviewed by the Windies. Roach got it to tail in from outside off, Seelaar seemed to get the front pad outside the line before the ball thudded into it. Replays awaited, I think it hit outside the line
back of a length outside off, stays back and forces it back down the ground
more width outside off this time, a defensive push to backward point
even more width and it is cut away square for a single this time
full and wide outside off, Seelaar lets it go this time
short and wide outside off, Seelaar cracks the cut away through point for a single
slowish offcutter outside off, stays low as Cooper pushes it into the covers

Seelaar is gone. Is it lbw or caught? For now it is out one way of the other. Huge inducker, came in at pace, and seemed in a hurry to hit Seelaar's optimistically outstretched pad. It thuds into the foam in front of middle. Lbw it is. It bubbles up to short leg, without taking bat on the way. Doesn't matter, Seelaar's fate sealed already.

and another. Will this be reviewed? Roach has got another lbw out of Taufel. And no, it is not being reviewed. He has five and is on a hat-trick. Well bowled Roachie. Fuller delivery this time, looking for the stumps and nipping in alarmingly. Loots did his best, he tried to cover the line with bat and pad, but the ball hit him on the shin in front of off. Loots looked bemused and consulted with Cooper and then went on his way without reviewing.

hat-trick for Roach and he has six wickets! Superb spell this, the sheen barely taken off it by the fact that it came against a poor opposition. Fielders came in everywhere. Three slips I could see on the screen. A short leg in place. The odds of Westdijk surviving this were not very good. Roach got another vicious inducker in place. Landed it outside off stump and got it to curl in rapidly. Westdijk stayed on the crease and made a feeble attempt to stop it. No luck. Middle stump is flattened, and I think Roach will put it on his mantelpiece. Sixth hat-trick in World Cup cricket, and boy, it was a treat to watch!
